Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: the parlor
The parlor.

Bay windows look out from the parlor towards the drive and front lawn. This room is furnished to encourage quiet conversation; a comfortable sofa is set in the window bay, facing the fireplace, and chairs are set to either side of the fireplace, facing each other. A low table is set in the middle of the room, on an oriental rug. Doors lead east and west from here.
http://www.skotos.net/MansionGame/images/Parlor.jpg
the eastern door
In the northern half of the east wall is a panelled oak door. A brass knob is attached to the edge of the door.
the western door
In the northern half of the west wall is a panelled oak door. A brass knob is attached to the edge of the door.
the eastern green-upholstered armchair

This armchair is covered in holly-green woven fabric; only the beechwood legs are uncovered. The arms and back, built as a continuous piece wrapping around the seat, curve outwards and down slightly. The chair is standing in the northern end of the parlor, facing west towards another similar chair past the fireplace.
An armchair, upholstered in holly-green woven fabric; only the beechwood legs are uncovered. It is standing in the northern end of the parlor, facing another chair.
the northeastern green armchair's arm
Both arms of this holly-green upholstered armchair curve outwards and down towards the floor.
The green fabric upholstered arms of an armchair.
the eastern armchair's back
The curved back of this holly-green armchair is cushioned with woven broadcloth.
The back of the green fabric-upholstered armchair.
the eastern armchair's beechwood leg
The four beechwood legs of this green-upholstered armchair are square, and end in brass feet.
The legs of this fabric-covered armchair are made from beechwood.
the eastern armchair's seat
The seat cushion of this armchair is covered in woven holly-green broadcloth
The armchair's seat cushion is covered in green cloth.
the western green-upholstered armchair

This armchair is covered in holly-green woven fabric; only the beechwood legs are uncovered. The arms and back, built as a continuous piece wrapping around the seat, curve outwards and down slightly. The chair is standing in the northern end of the parlor, facing east towards another similar chair past the fireplace.
An armchair, upholstered in holly-green woven fabric; only the beechwood legs are uncovered. It is standing in the northern end of the parlor, facing another chair.
the northwestern green armchair's arm
Both arms of this holly-green upholstered armchair curve outwards and down towards the floor.
The green fabric upholstered arms of an armchair.
the western armchair's back
The curved back of this holly-green armchair is cushioned with woven broadcloth.
The back of the green fabric-upholstered armchair.
the western armchair's beechwood leg
The four beechwood legs of this green-upholstered armchair are square, and end in brass feet.
The legs of this fabric-covered armchair are made from beechwood.
the western armchair's seat
The seat cushion of this armchair is covered in woven holly-green broadcloth
The armchair's seat cushion is covered in green cloth.
the fire
A gently-burning log fire is warming the parlor from within the fireplace.
the fireplace

A fancy marble fireplace is built into the north wall, with a gently crackling fire within it. The mantelpiece is a fancifully-carved work of art, with a mirror built into the chimneyfront above it. Armchairs face each other before the fireplace.
the table leg
The legs of this low wooden table are smooth posts, attached to the corners of the table top. They are standing on the oriental rug.
The table legs are smooth, classicly-simple wooden posts.
the fireplace
The marble fireplace mantel is a fancifully-carved work of art, surrounded by delicately rendered foliage. Built into the chimneyfront, above the mantel, is a mirror.
the mirror built into the north wall
A square mirror, smooth and shiny, is built into the marble chimneyfront on the north wall. In the mirror, you see:
A square mirror, smooth and shiny, is built into the marble chimneyfront on the north wall. The mirror shows in .
the large oriental rug
This is a large, rectangular, oriental rug with bright designs woven into it. It is laid in the middle of the room; a low table is standing on it.
A large oriental rug.
An oriental rug in the middle of the room; a low table is standing on it. The rug is covered with bright designs.
the oriental rug's edges
The tasselled sides of an oriental rug.
the oriental rug's center
The center of an oriental rug; a low table is standing on the rug.
the comfortable holly-green sofa

This sofa has ample soft cushions and padding; the upholstery is holly-green fabric. The arms are of a wide rounded scroll form; the back rises above the arms, and widens a bit above them. Skirts all around the base hide the sofa's feet. The sofa is placed at the southern end of the room, facing north.
A comfortable, holly-green sofa, placed at the southern end of the room.
the green sofa's arm
Both arms of this comfortable sofa are wide, rounded scrolls, covered and cushioned in holly-green fabric.
The fabric-covered arms of the green sofa.
the back of the green sofa
The broad back of this massive oak sofa is cushioned with dark brown leather, and rises to only thirty inches above the floor.
The back of the green sofa has two wide cushions.
the sofa's leg
The six legs of this massive sofa (including two under the middle) are square, carved from cherry-stained oak in a craftsman style.
The legs of this massive sofa are angular cherry-stained oak.
the green sofa's seat
The holly-green sofa's seat is covered in ample cushions.
The sofa's seat has ample green cushions.
the low beechwood table
This is a low, classicly simple table. The top is smooth and well-polished. The table is set in the middle of the parlor, on the oriental rug.
A low, polished table set in the middle of the room.
the table top
The smooth, polished table top is a rectangular surface of unmarked beechwood.
The top of the table is made of smooth, polished wood.
the view of the lawn and drive through the bay windows
Through the bay windows, you can see:
Through the bay windows, you can see:
the east wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the east wall of the hall; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice. An oak-panelled door is set in this wall.
the north wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the north wall of the hall; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall. A fancy marble fireplace is built into this wall; the mantelpiece is a fancifully-carved work of art.
the south wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the south wall of the hall; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice. This wall curves outwards to form a bay; three windows are set in the wall. A comfortable sofa is standing in this window bay.
the west wall

Carefully panelled oak wainscotting rises to about six feet high on the west wall of the hall; cream-colored plaster covers the remainder of the wall, up to the ceiling cornice. An oak-panelled door is set in the wall.
the window bay
A wide window bay curves outward in the south wall; three windows are set in it. A comfortable sofa is set in the window bay, facing north. The window provides a view of the front lawn and drive.
the windows
Three windows are set in the window bay, with a view of the drive and front lawn in the darkness.

Notes:Category.Notes:Note: A room for pleasant conversation in the mansion.
